Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful! Our stay was wonderful! We were able to make the west wing a perfect get away to the Ludington area for my wife, toddler, and I.
The location is quiet and serene. The view from the back deck overlooking the lake is routinely blessed with a family of 3-6 deer that come in every morning and evening to eat the tall grass and wildflowers growing. A nice pathway is cut through the tall grass to allow access to the canoes/kayaks and dock.
The home has no central air, but the copious windows allow plenty of fresh cool air in. At no point during our stay was the home too warm. A portable air conditioner is set up in the living room but we didn’t need to turn it on.
The hosts were kind and very attentive to our needs.
Many reviews discussed the privacy, and I know it’s been an issue for some people. The guest house is a wing of the main home. It is very private and only connected through the home gym/sauna/spa room. There are multiple doors separating the guest house and the bedrooms are opposite of a second garage not the main home. At only one point did my wife even hear the hosts in their house while we stayed.
We cannot wait to return!

Nearby, too, was Ludington State Park where we hiked the dunes, woods and strolled next to historic Lincoln River.
We especially enjoyed watching sunrises and sunsets from the deck, sharing moments with a family of deer grazing on native grasses and tree leaves.
We loved our stay here, wishing we had another week in this peaceful place. It was a gift.

review_text:
Unit 4 is a clean, two-bedroom, two-bathroom, fully-remodeled apartment above a large furniture store on Ludington Avenue. The brickwork and masonry make the building appear historic, but inside the apartments everything is new.
The kitchen and bedrooms are large, and there is a small sitting area with a TV as well as a dining nook. There also may have been a TV and one of the bedrooms. There is a fold-out sofa bed in the sitting area, as well. Everything is bright and cheery.
Finding the location was easy. There was ample street parking nearby. I did not bother using the garage. There is no obvious elevator, so be prepared to ascend one large flight of stairs to arrive at the rental units.
There is quite a bit of road noise, even through the night, so I recommend closing the windows and using the air conditioning, even if it is a cooler night.
Regarding the host, he was accessible and accommodating. I made a mistake with our reservation dates, and when I called the host to request a change—after business hours on a holiday weekend—he immediately appeared in person and graciously amended the reservation at the last minute. Much appreciated.
Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would go back. Highly recommended.

We would highly recommend staying at the Harrington Lofts!
We are two adults who stayed there with our two children (ages 2 and 6) for a long weekend in July. The location of this loft is incredible! It sits above a furniture store which means nighttime is quiet compared to other downtown rentals, but walk across the street and you have nightlife there!
The loft, #4, has two very comfortable king beds and a pullout couch great for kids. Finished such as quartz countertops and high end cabinets add to the upscale/modern feel and the keyed entry to the units adds an element of security (not that we ever felt a need for security but it’s nice to have that feeling of safety when traveling with kids).
We arrived a bit early but were able to check-in and go right to the loft which was great. Private parking is available behind the building but we parked right next to the entry most days which worked out well. This really is the perfect location. Walking distance to shops, restaurants, and bars. A quick 5 minute drive to the beach which could easily be done on bike too!
The only suggestions we have for improving the loft would be to add some area rugs and change from polyester sheets to cotton. We would highly recommend staying here and would come back ourselves.
